page.title: 10Shipbourne a century ago
page.content: Shipbourne last century had everything the people needed.People had work without going out of the village.There were shops and a school for children from all around.Most people worked on the Fairlawn Estate.Many people were needed to work in the fields because there was no machinery. The school log book tells us that a number of children were off school working on the land by reaping the corn, stringing the hops,stone picking,sowing beans and cutting the hops.We can tell that hops were grown in Shipbourne by the number of converted oast houses that are here. Mr.Cazalet,the owner of Fairlawn, built many of the houses that there are in Shipbourne,such as New Cottages.He also built a new church for the village. Caroline and Ellen
